website_summaries.verdict: The extended-length chain and powerful 15-amp motor make this the right tool for users with frequent large jobs or commercial jobs.
pros: The extra reach of this 18-inch chain allows users to cut more area faster than regular-length chains, and the motor is the most powerful of any model we considered
This means the WG304.1 can fell or chop even the largest trees commonly found on most properties
The kickback bar is positioned for easy reach during use, offering added safety on large jobs
Chain tensioning and lubrication is automatic, time-saving features that allow users to work more efficiently
cons: Since it is designed for the kind of big jobs that often happen at the edge of properties, we wish the cord did not limit how far users can go from a power source

customer_reviews.title: Don’t be tempted by the price, buy a Makita
customer_reviews.text: This saw has a powerful motor and works great until the cheap plastic drive gears strip out. No spare parts are sold anywhere. It is a throwaway tool. Save yourself the aggravation, and wasting your money and spring for the Makita chain saw, as I should have done initially instead of wasting $90 on this piece of junk with no customer support.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Leaked a ton of oil
customer_reviews.text: The oil reservoir began leaking out the bottom of the saw barely 3 months after I bought it. UPDATE: they just informed me this is not covered by warranty, they expect that oil will leak out the bottom of the saw. They advise draining the reservoir after use. I guess I got spoiled by my old Black & Decker chainsaw that didn’t leak.
customer_reviews.author: CB

customer_reviews.title: Great saw
customer_reviews.text: This saw is not equivalent to my gas-powered Husky, no matter what anyone says. On the other hand, for $110, it cuts down trees just fine and handles limbing and just about anything I need a chainsaw for. And it does so without mixing oil and gas, without have to pull a rope and without needing any tools to change a chain or adjust tension. At my age, these are all good things. I have no problem with cords and hate running out of battery power on a cordless. Also the rechargeable batteries add alot of weight. This is a great saw for the money and it does everything it should, so far.
customer_reviews.author: Family Jewels

customer_reviews.title: Does not work!  DOA
customer_reviews.text: Received this saw and after a couple weeks I got around to trying to use it. After adding chain oil and connecting an extension cord the power trigger does not work. The trigger lock works and trigger seems to work but NO POWER to motor. I have tried 2 different cords and 2 different power sockets with same results. Now Amazon says this item is not returnable. VERY DISAPPOINTED!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The gear inside is plastic, I found this out ...
customer_reviews.text: The gear inside is plastic, I found this out the hard way, in the middle of cutting a log and heard a grinding sound. Having it for a few months I would expect this to be either replaceable or serviceable, it seems that it is not. Don't buy this saw, I only wish I could return mine.
customer_reviews.author: Darin York

customer_reviews.title: don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: Bought this chainsaw, December 2019, after using it two times within half a year, it stops working for no reasons. Called the customer number 866-354-WORX (9679), it will automatically hang up your call if you select the menu to talk to the customer care rep. Called multiple times during different hours, the same thing: you cannot talk to a person to honor their two-year warranty. on the website, ask you to all, during the call, ask you to browse the website.
customer_reviews.author: Kuluhe

customer_reviews.title: you'll get screwed like I did
customer_reviews.text: This is a new piece of Junk! Does nothing! Won't turn on! Don't buy Amazon will not return for refund, you'll get screwed like I did!!!
customer_reviews.author: Mr. TJ. Shepard

customer_reviews.title: After only a short time of running fine, (less than a month) the auto tension feature ...
customer_reviews.text: After only a short time of running fine, (less than a month) the auto tension feature didn't work. Still waiting for Worx CS to correct problem after a month.
customer_reviews.author: James  Adams

customer_reviews.title: Stay Away
customer_reviews.text: Bought this last year but did not get to use it till today. Fresh out of the box it does not turn on. DOA. I have cheche the power source and the extension cord with other appliance and it is all fine. Amazon can o nothing because it has been a while since I bought it. Will try calling the manufacturer directly and see what they can do. But at this time I have no hope. Never like thinks not working right out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: Srinivasa Prasad

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after 3 sessions
customer_reviews.text: The chainsaw was great when it worked, it cut down oaks that were about a foot across, then it didn't work. When I looked inside the trigger mechanism was not reaching a lever that needed to be engaged. Even though I used it only three times, it was beyond warranty. Worx was not much help. They offered to sell me a new machine at a price that was $20 higher than Amazon. Works well as a paperweight.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: great chainsaw for the money
customer_reviews.text: great chainsaw for the money! I never had a gas chainsaw so I cannot compare the power but this suited its purpose well for me. I was able to cut through logs over 24 inches in diameter as a big tree fell in the backyard. This store is perfect for the average homeowner who needs to cut some wood or clear some brush. I like the fact that it is not noisy like a gas powered saws.
customer_reviews.author: marcinri

customer_reviews.title: This saw is a beast
customer_reviews.text: This chain saw is powerful, lightweight and tougher than any one I've ever used. Yesterday I was cutting some privacy fence damaged by Hurricane Laura. Cut through two 4x4s i had joined together for strength. Cut through it effortlessly. Accidentally hit a dead 110 volt line. Tangled up in the chain. Took off the bar n chain. Pulled out the wire reassembled and went back to work in three minutes. This little saw is a beast. Don't worry about pampering it. Treat it like a tough tool. Follow the safety tips but you won't easily hurt it.
customer_reviews.author: Mike7763

customer_reviews.title: Garbage!!
customer_reviews.text: Do not waste your money on this garbage, the inner gears are made of plastic, it lasted 30 minutes before started to smoke and the inner plastic gears to wear out. I bought this because of the high amps but I ended up returning this and spending 43 bucks in the harbort freight one and it turn out to be 10 times better since they change the plastic gears for steel ones in the new model. And half of the price of this one
customer_reviews.author: Javier

customer_reviews.title: Never worked - Bought a year ago, just took out of box
customer_reviews.text: I didn’t realize this was electric when I bought it. This never powered on. I read all the instructions and have called support. The only thing I think I can do since I waited beyond the 30 day satisfaction guarantee is to exercise the 3yr limited warranty to have this replaced. Update: I figured out how to power it on. Tried it and works ok. I hope it’s durable enough as I saw my brother in law using two electric saws and chain constantly falling off and not powerful enough to cut a big tree. My brother had a cheaper gas saw and his never had any issues.
customer_reviews.author: SIRENO

customer_reviews.title: Sharp, powerful and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I had purchased two cords of wood that were all cut too long. This video shows the last rack of wood being cut at the end of the two cords.... still almost as sharp as the beginning... The chain and bar never got hot even with continuous use for more than an hour. I used all the original bar oil and refilled it once and used most of that, so one filling per cord of wood more or less.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: This chainsaw is Awesome
customer_reviews.text: I needed to take down 7 trees in my yard. Their diameters were between 9" to 5". This saw took them down without any problem; they were each at least 18 to 25 feet high. The saw cut them up without any difficulty at all too. You must however keep the chainsaw oiler from going dry while working, keep an eye on the level. Don't let it run dry that would make the saw very hard to work with and possibly break it. But all chainsaws have that same problem of needing constant lubrication!
customer_reviews.author: eric arechavala

customer_reviews.title: but it just seems like it could have been handled better
customer_reviews.text: Plenty of power for an electric and I have yet to be able to bog mine down, though I am mostly cutting tropical trees and not hardwoods. The only reason I took a star away is that the mechanism for loosening the chain also holds the bar on. If you unscrew the big plastic "knob" on the side to clean out debris, the chain and bar are going to fall off. This is a pain because now you have to balance everything together to get it reassembled without dropping it in the dirt. This is probably a product of the "automatic chain tensioner" system, but it just seems like it could have been handled better.
customer_reviews.author: D

customer_reviews.title: Awesome saw, I have taken down 6 big trees ...
customer_reviews.text: Awesome saw, I have taken down 6 big trees with this chainsaw and bucked them up into firewood. No issues saw has plenty of power and out performs many of the home use saws I have owned. Best thing about it is no need to run to gas station or store for 2 stroke oil. Also don't have to worry bout gas sitting in carb to long or trying to pull start it in the. Old. It's always ready to go. Another awesome feature is the auto chain tensioner. No need to keep loosening bar to adjust chain inbetween cuts. Highly recommend this saw for anyone looking to cut down medium size trees with occasional big one around there property.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fast job for what I need it for.
customer_reviews.text: I live out in the country, with A LOT of trees on my property. Haven't had a chance to give it hard workout yet, but cut a downed tree into pieces very quickly. Read a number of "reviews", and noticed several people complained about this saw leaking chain oil when sits idle for awhile. Mine does also ! Just put in enough for current job, then put the saw somewhere where some leakage will damage anything (ie: floor). Could no get it to turn on first time. Read the instructions dummy ! Have to pull the safety / stop bar back first. Men NEVER read instructions first. Takes the challenge out of things
customer_reviews.author: charlie pendleton

customer_reviews.title: Great product, it does the job!
customer_reviews.text: The price is great! At this price, I was thinking that would be good enough for small branches! To mu surprise, on a first use today, I cut down four trees with diameters ranging from 5 inches to 10 inches without any problem! I also did a few chopping of existing fallen trees. You pay almost the same amount for a day rental for gas chain saw. The money well spent, it is a great product. and ready to use, add oil and plug it in and go for it!
customer_reviews.author: No NAME

customer_reviews.title: Good Product
customer_reviews.text: I had a bunch of 3-8" trees that needed to be removed and this chainsaw worked out perfectly. Much easier than a gas powered chainsaw, especially for small jobs. The chain popped off only once on a difficult cut but was easily refitted and tightened without any major issues. The only issue is that the chain oil seems to run out - I filled it and by the time I finished cutting down the trees, the oil was all gone. That is my only gripe with the chainsaw. I guess I will need to go buy more before using it again. Overall, I am very pleased with the purchase and the chainsaw helped remove several trees with ease.
customer_reviews.author: David Ishmael

customer_reviews.title: Get the Additional Oil - Uses It Up Quick
customer_reviews.text: This is my first chainsaw. I saw a YT reviewer that said if you dont saw wood often, then an e-chainsaw is a great bet - no fussing with fuel mixes, etc. Plugs in and works right out the box. Fantastic. Make sure you get the recommended chain oil because the one that comes with the chainsaw is small and not enough - and you will burn through it quick. Cuts through really well - cuts big, large sized trunks and branches. Works really well, cuts well, and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: LadyK

customer_reviews.title: A very capable saw
customer_reviews.text: It threw its chain twice during one hour work cutting up a large oak branch. I like the automatic tensioner, but it seems that it needs to be checked frequently. This saw has plenty of power and cuts very fast. I would have awarded five stars if the chain did not loosen so much during work that it came off the sprocket. Not difficult to fix, but aggravating. Just got to loosen the knob and then re-tighten during the job before the chain gets so loose as to come off of the sprocket. Now that I am aware of this, I expect no more problems with it.
customer_reviews.author: Bluemaxx 2001

customer_reviews.title: Great Chainsaw
customer_reviews.text: I live in a heavily wooded area. Over the last 25 years I have owned every type of chainsaw. Cordless, gas, and electric. Running an electric cord is a small problem, compared to the power of this chainsaw. It is the most powerful of the three types, and makes quick work of big trees, some larger than 16 inches diameter. I use a 14 gauge 100 ft. cord, and if needed, connect it to a 50 ft. 16 gauge cord. At 150 feet, there is very little power loss. The important thing is to let the saw do the cutting, and don't try to push it to hard through the cut. This saw is a monster.
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: Excellent chainsaw, excellent power...
customer_reviews.text: Excellent chainsaw, excellent value. Very powerful and efficient, I cut everything from 10 inch diameter limbs down to thumb-diameter branches. By far, the best chainsaw I have ever owned without the headaches of trying to start a small two-stroke engine every year. Don't want to ever hear the sound of a non-starting gas chainsaw ever again. I have to say that the Worx 18" electric chainsaw is one of the very best yard care purchases I have ever made--apart from my lawnmower made by a certain car company. The reviews originally sold me on this tool/machine--and they are right. This chainsaw is simply excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Granamo

customer_reviews.title: Half an hour to cut all this.
customer_reviews.text: i bought this to clean up limbs and some fallen branches. I had a 80 foot tree that was taken down and laying in the yard so I decided to try out this saw to see if it could handle cutting up the tree. It performed magnificently! With the Rip chain it ate through the 26 inch Ash log like it was soft butter. It kept cutting and didn't stall or jam like my 20 inch Huskvarna. highly recommend this if you are going to cut up a load of firewood or fell trees.
customer_reviews.author: Roger Ranapi

customer_reviews.title: Plug and Play, I'm sold!
customer_reviews.text: Works better than expected to be honest. Plenty powerful and not excessively heavy. Perfect for lite use cleaning up around the yard and dealing with small to medium sized trees that need to come down. Never again will I fight with a gas chainsaw that refuses to start because it's sat on a shelf for a year or more, the reliability factor alone of a literal plug and play tool makes this an unbelievable valve for anyone who has a yard that occasionally needs the odd tree cut up.
customer_reviews.author: Becky

customer_reviews.title: Worthless
customer_reviews.text: Worked for 20 minutes then just spun internally. Plastic gear inside spun out. No replacements, no refunds, Amazon will not help you neither will extended warranty. Good luck dealing with worx themselves. Buy only if you want to cut small branches.
customer_reviews.author: Darla P.

customer_reviews.title: Did a great job with tree
customer_reviews.text: Just used to take down a 30' Bradford Pear tree. Worked great. Chain came off twice during 2 hours of cutting, but was very easy to put back on by removing the auto tensioner. Plenty of power. Used on standard extension cord and did not pop 20A breaker. Auto tensioner loosens a little during cutting as it comes in contact with whats being cut, could have some type of locking device to make it better. Great value for the $98 I paid for it.
customer_reviews.author: Gdog in DE

customer_reviews.title: Oil leak after 6 months
customer_reviews.text: I liked this chainsaw at the beginning. It's light weighted and good enough for most backyard work. I noticed bad oil leakage 2 days ago when I rearranged my garage. I only used it 3 times: cut 2 small trees, and trimmed another. It's been in the garage for about 2 months after the last use. I have no idea when this started but cannot believe that happened after only 6 months...
customer_reviews.author: GY

customer_reviews.title: Not great, not good, ok at best
customer_reviews.text: It's light weight, easy to use, and works ok when it's working. Unfortunately: It drinks oil like mad The chain falls off constantly, and it certainly doesn't "auto tension" the chain like it says it does. In the end, I wish I'd gone with a different brand, and may end up returning it should it continue to exhibit flaws
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Dresden

customer_reviews.title: One pleasantly surprised customer
customer_reviews.text: Used out of the box to slice and dice a 20-in oak that split at about 15 feet and fell. Well balanced, quiet, powerful. Kept oiled and adjusted. Cut almost as well as a gas saw. Excellent value for money. No indication that the saw will not continue to meet my infrequent needs. Product packaging boxes the motor but leaves the chain and bar exposed, covered by a sheath. Very susceptible to damage. Amazon put product package in a larger box enclosing the sheath, but did not secure the product box, so the product box and sheath were free to move. Shipping box arrived undamaged, but sheath was torn at the open end from shifting during shipping. Needs improvement.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Lousy instructions
customer_reviews.text: Used it to trim tree branches, and it was very easy to use, and made it quick job. CONS: Instructions are bad. 1. Safety stop around hand NOT obvious. I was ready to return unit back, because it did not start. Called the ckmpany, and had to pull it really hard to enable safety. 2. Discussion of how much oil should be in reservoir. Unit came with 100ml, which fills it about 1/3 way - well below the window to check oil level. Filling more than 100ml, might result in what others reported as 'oil leak'.
customer_reviews.author: Victor

customer_reviews.title: Incredible value for money
customer_reviews.text: I was blown away at how good it cuts, Iv had gas chainsaws for years. But the instant start of electric really makes me think twice about dragging them out. It’s cheap and chinsy feeling , No doubt about it but I abused the ever living crap out of this thing for hours and hours rough cutting slabs and it still runs fine. Keep the chain sharp and keep it full of oil and it should do whatever you need it too. Even the chain it comes with is very good
customer_reviews.author: Mark frank

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly Good
customer_reviews.text: I’m surprised by this electric chainsaw. Most others in the same category lack the chain brake safety that this has. That is the main reason why I went with this instead of the green works 18” chainsaw. Otherwise this had a lot of the similar features, like the metal spikes, 18” bar, and the amount of power. If you occasionally need a chainsaw, this is a good one to get.
customer_reviews.author: B. W.

customer_reviews.title: Performs great!
customer_reviews.text: My son is thrilled with this chain saw. I don't know how it could be any better. I ordered one from the warehouse with "cosmetic issues" but it didn't even turn on. (Cosmetically it looked perfect.) That was a quick & easy return at Kohl's & I didn't even have to package it. This was the replacement. It arrived quickly & works beautifully. We love it!
customer_reviews.author: E. Harvey

customer_reviews.title: For an occasional user, easy to use and powerful enough.
customer_reviews.text: Need it for the occasional homeowner task sometimes 9 months to a year apart. Last week used it after it was sitting idle for 9 months. I cut up a fallen Pine tree and branches on my driveway into manageable pieces with a contractors truck blocked from getting out. The trunk was 8" thick and I was surprised how quick this unit cut through. Being electric, I didn't have the anxiety of hoping the gas engine would start. Make sure you use a 12 guage extension cord to avoid losing power through voltage drops in thinner wire.
customer_reviews.author: kasdesign

customer_reviews.title: My new favorite toy
customer_reviews.text: I liked this chainsaw right out of the box: Zero hassle electric, but beefy enough to get some real work done. This weekend, I managed to get so many vines and twigs jammed up in it that it threw the chain. Being totally new to this, my first thought was, "Uh-oh. I'm screwed." I broke down and dug out the instructions. There. I said it. This chainsaw just went from good to GREAT: Twist one big knob and the whole thing can be disassembled and repaired -- NO TOOLS -- unless you count the chicken feather I used to get crud out from behind the sprocket :-)
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth B. Sizer II

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly great chain saw
customer_reviews.text: I wasnt expecting an electric chain saw to out perform a gas chain saw, but thats what happened. It does the job with ease. I cut down my parents mulberry tree. The waa about 40 years old and was groqing to cloae to their home. It cut every limb and trunk on that tree with ease. Make sure you order extra bar and chain oil. Youll need it. Very happy with it
customer_reviews.author: dan

customer_reviews.title: awesome customer service
customer_reviews.text: I bought this chainsaw (WG304.1) last year, unfortunately it failed to start after I use it for 2 days to cut down few trees and taking care of tree trunks. Customer service at Worx was able to replace the saw for me promptly. Amazon does not even bother to take the broken one back. I have being using this chainsaw for a year without any issues. I would rate 4 stars for the saw, but definitely 5 stars for the service! for that reason, I have other products from Worx too. (eg. WG520). highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Alina

customer_reviews.title: Great chainsaw. Lasts a long time. Easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: This is absolutely my favorite chainsaw. I like that it’s electric. I don’t have to mess with priming it or mixing the fuel. Also the chainsaw is significantly lighter without the gas. I like this chainsaw so much that I’ve bought it three times! And each one works perfectly. Very easy to sharpen. There’s an outline of the correct direction to put the chain on. So no mistakes of ruining your chain by putting it on backwards.
customer_reviews.author: Shorton25

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic machine!
customer_reviews.text: Total pleasure using this Chinese made saw. Bought 12 logger Cords of red Oak and this tool goes through them like they are butter. Of course I'm cutting up Oak so I've had to have it sharpened once so far. Like any other chain saw you need to keep chain lube flowing through it. The cord can be an issue when you start getting tired so be careful. My Canadian wife thought I was crazy buying this. It proved her wrong. She is sold. I think I'll get her the smaller version so she can take care of the smaller logs.
customer_reviews.author: James A. Yochum

customer_reviews.title: Powerful for an electric
customer_reviews.text: This 18" electric chainsaw is very powerful yet lightweight. For most trimming jobs, this chainsaw does the job well. It does use a lot of chain oil during operation, and the chain has a tendency to come off if the tightening mechanism isn't set just right... but once one becomes familiar with the unit, it's a great tool. It won't replace your gas chainsaw for big jobs, but for the majority of tree trimming, this chainsaw will be your go to trimmer.
customer_reviews.author: Arn

customer_reviews.title: Very handy, not bulky for what I use it for.
customer_reviews.text: Put in the lube, and and it cuts like it's suppose to. Very effective for what I purchased it for and that is small trees and overgrown shrubbery. I like the idea of it coming with a sheath when done, and the safety mechanism. I would recommend this for anyone with small to medium jobs. Will update in the future if I need to.
customer_reviews.author: Dexter J.

customer_reviews.title: TERRIBLE. Silly me. I thought I could cut trees with this. It's a pruner called a chainsaw.
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight. Not dependable. Not the chainsaw you need. Not worth the low price of $99. Worked fine for about 8 hours of use. Now sounds like it's going to blow up in my hands. And of course, it's past the return window. Total waste of money for anyone looking for a chainsaw. Good for pruning. 18" blade is more decorative than anything because it can't cut anything more than 8" wide.
customer_reviews.author: Max Rocket

customer_reviews.title: After filling it with oil it just leaked oil and ...
customer_reviews.text: After filling it with oil it just leaked oil and leaked and leaked until the oil was gone in a couple of weeks. I didn't see any way to reduce the leaking. I didn't use it right away so I missed the return window by 3 days.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: great
customer_reviews.text: Cut through 30 24 to 30 inch rounds with ease, of course I had to cut from both sides often. Plenty of power and appears very well made. Chain still sharp even after all that cutting of mostly pine. Update 8/20. Plastic kick back guard has broken, not certain how or exactly when, I glued it together but if it breaks again the saw will not be safe to use. Not very strong material for the guard. Reduced the rating to just 3.
customer_reviews.author: sky

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: This little chainsaw has been a lifesaver. We have cut down quite a few trees, cut up thick branches, used it for storm cleanup several times, all sorts of stuff! Hasn't had one single issue, keep it oiled and clean and you shouldn't have any problems. I like that it's electric powered because you never have to worry about running out of gas. It's pretty lightweight so its easy to use for hours without tiring out.
customer_reviews.author: Darby

customer_reviews.title: Palo Verde wood is very damp and super hard to saw through manually
customer_reviews.text: This chain saw paid for itself in a matter of a few hours. I trimmed two large Palo Verde trees with would have cost me hundreds of dollars. It tore through large tree limbs with ease! Palo Verde wood is very damp and super hard to saw through manually, but this saw went through it without any problem. It used little or no chain oil and the chain stayed very shard after many, many cuts. This was the best $92 I've ever spent! BUT: IT LEAKS FROM THE CHAIN OIL TANK. SO I HAVE TO KEEP IT IN AN OIL PAN. THAT'S NOT CONVENIENT FOR COMPACT STORAGE!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Junk.
customer_reviews.text: It worked fine for a minute, then the bar got pinched for a second. I pulled it out and from that point forward the chainsaw went from smelly to seemingly underpowered to blowing showers of sparks out of the motor housing in about 4 seconds flat. Couldn't be more disappointed, will definitely talk anyone I know out of buying worx products.
customer_reviews.author: Awa

customer_reviews.title: Can’t go wrong for light work
customer_reviews.text: For the price of the saw, you can’t go wrong. I was quoted $600 for the tree work I completed for $100 by buying this. Worked great. Enough power to get through a solid 20” tree and blade was sharp enough to finish the job and then some. Saw bogged down a few times with the pressure on the blade, but that happens with all saws. Only complain is obviously running 150’ of extension cord, but that’s the obvious flaw to buying an electric saw. I have several “worx” tools and this one compliments the others nicely.
customer_reviews.author: R.B.

customer_reviews.title: Does what it has to.
customer_reviews.text: Self tensioning feature ok A bit off center balance because the handle is not as wide as others such as the black and decker 18”. Chain break works well and on/off is quick. The oil cap is a bit flimsy. Would be better with some tabs on top for easier grip. Again, at this price point, there’s not much difference between many of the saws of this type.
customer_reviews.author: Zach Gabai

customer_reviews.title: Buy the Warranty
customer_reviews.text: This unit has a safety feature that can make it appear as inoperable. It is the handle in front of the oil cap. That must be engaged for the unit to work properly. I used mine for 10-20 hours and waited a year to use it again. Should the unit not work, the re-seller will not honor the exchange/return. Fill out the registration card and you are covered for 3 years as well. Lesson learned
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Chain kept falling off
customer_reviews.text: When the chain didn't fall off, it cut fairly well although anything over 1" in diameter, it struggled with. I've had it a month and the chain has fallen off at least a half dozen times. It takes 5-10 minutes to put it back on. This wasn't a very expensive saw so I guess you get what you pay for. I wouldn't buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: John V. Madormo

customer_reviews.title: quiet enough for indoors
customer_reviews.text: i bought this to trim green wood for bowl turning blanks. it is surprisingly beastly, quiet, and very easy to handle. after 4 months of use it shows no signs of slowing down, and i use it in my basement without hearing protection. only complaints: it does suck down the bar and chain oil, and the shavings get clogged behind the chain, but for the price and decibels, its still 5 stars
customer_reviews.author: E. Zelnick

customer_reviews.title: Great saw
customer_reviews.text: Works great, just make sure you crank the chain tensioner all the way down when you use it then loosen and tighten again after 5 or so cuts. It basically uses a spring tension system for the tension. You will need to retention after the chain heats up and stretches. After that it works great. Will work on a 15 amp breaker with 15 ft cord. Did about 60 cuts.
customer_reviews.author: B. Jensen

customer_reviews.title: Not bad, not bad at all
customer_reviews.text: Not a bad saw for the money. It does like bar oil though. Use a 10 gauge extension cord on it, the 12 gauge I started with was ok but the saw really perked up on the 10 gauge.
customer_reviews.author: JustaDudeTop Contributor: Fountain Pens

customer_reviews.title: Wow!
customer_reviews.text: It arrived 1 pm yesterday. I had it unpacked, the chain/bar lube in it, and it plugged in by 1:30 pm. 3 and a half hours later I finished for the night with the front of my property done. It's 100 feet from my front door to the street. I got up this morning and finished the side and the back of the house. Today was also about 3 and a half hours. It's powerful, easy to use, and lightweight. I'm glad I bought it. This is my first electric chainsaw. It's great.
customer_reviews.author: John Stevens

customer_reviews.title: Works like a champ
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazing saw. I got so tired of pulling out my gas saw and spending time pulling and cleaning the carb to use. This is always ready. I've cut 24 inch pecans down and cut the wood up. It has plenty of power, and doesnt weight a ton. The tensioner works well and keeps the chain tight. I do use thinner oil for the chain.
customer_reviews.author: michael miller

customer_reviews.title: Little Powerhouse
customer_reviews.text: Wow was I surprised what great a little saw this is (I shouldn't call it little). I always buy gas powered lawn equipment for well, the extra power. So I used it to cut up 100 feet green oak logs. This electric saw went through that oak like a hot knife through butter. I bought an extra chain and didn't need it. I'm running out of compliments for this saw. Very impressive.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Gearhart Sr.

customer_reviews.title: Solid saw for home use.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this saw in 2014 (5 years ago) and have used it to chop down 7 trees around my house. Was checking amazons price (HD is cheaper right now) as i plan on buying it again and noticed i had never reviewed it. Many of these were large trees that had been in place for 50-60 years that the previous owners had never even trimmed, that had grown to the point where they had become liabilities. This saw handled all i could throw at it, until this last weekend when it finally gave up the ghost. Aside from routine care and replacing the chain a few times, it has performed extremely well.
customer_reviews.author: bcc

customer_reviews.title: great cut but...
customer_reviews.text: works great and cuts like buttah. only issue is that the plug seemed to overheat and stopped working , i cleaned out the plug area and eventually started working again without any issues. I believe it was overworked so i won’t use for as long as i did when it happened (about an hour) of continuous cutting
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Chung

customer_reviews.title: Great chainsaw for quick jobs around the house.
customer_reviews.text: This electric chainsaw worked perfect for what I needed. I cut up a large tree and a few smaller ones that fell after a storm. It is quiet and safely chewed through the wood. From reading reviews I was aware to make sure plenty of oil was available and to empty it afterwards.
customer_reviews.author: Randall R

customer_reviews.title: Highly reccommended.
customer_reviews.text: This saw is awesome for the jobs I use it for. It has sailed through all kinds of wood including yellow Locust which is very hard. I use 12 gauge cords and have gone up to 150 feet with no issues. The chain is still throwing out nice wood flakes due to it's sharpness. I purchased an additional chain but have yet to need it. Mind you I am not cutting wood for a business just thinning and dropping dead trees. The saw does use a fair amount of chain oil but it is easily obtainable and I keep a gallon on hand.
customer_reviews.author: Bartholomew61

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: This is the 2nd saw from Worx’s after the first started pouring oil and chain couldn’t be tightened. It was under warranty and after some back and forth with Worx’s customer service, they agreed to replace it but I did end up paying $22 for shipping and the old one was sent back. We live on 3+ acres and there are always trees to trim or dead. Hopefully this saw will last longer than the first one.
customer_reviews.author: Lois A. Hall

customer_reviews.title: worked amazingly well
customer_reviews.text: initially had issues with the chain slipping but i was not operating the chain saw right- once i figured it out i used it was hrs at a time for days and no issue- quite powerful and helped me save thousands clearing my yard of mid size dead trees, bushes and and whole lot more - I got ten times the value for the price-
customer_reviews.author: Fasttrax

customer_reviews.title: Great Saw: Close as you can get to gas power at a fraction of the weight
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Worx. The nylon internal gear got stripped then the saw got jammed in a cyclone fence. No problem, it affordable enough to replace, just wish they had a easy way to get replacement components. Eventually found a standard nylon chain saw gear I can use. Other than that be careful to store it horizontally as the chain saw oil will leak out. Also get the 18 inch...has more power.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas O'Brien

customer_reviews.title: WORX is indeed a cut above...
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased with the performance of this saw. I also have a 14-inch electric saw (Earthwise) that is good but not to this caliber of power tool. The Worx chain saw is powerful and easily cut through tree limbs and trunks. I would recommend that you use a power cord that can deliver the 15 amps, otherwise you are under-utilizing the motor and power of this saw. These cords may cost a bit more but the results should make you much happier (and potentially safer as the more powerful motor will drive the saw blade better and thus cut better).
customer_reviews.author: Fairportis

customer_reviews.title: DEAD ON ARRIVAL
customer_reviews.text: Unit was defective on receipt. Does not operate. A similar electric chainsaw works normally on the same electric cord. Amazon promptly arranged a refund. --- Update. Amazon does not require the product to be returned and is refunding the purchase price. While I am disappointed in the product, I am VERY PLEASED with Amazon's prompt handling of the problem.
customer_reviews.author: Lyle Johnson

customer_reviews.title: I have big experience with an electrical chainsaws and i Can sat that this is a good one. I posted 5 stars for the 16" ...
customer_reviews.text: Extremely powerfull chainsaw! I have big experience with an electrical chainsaws and i Can sat that this is a good one. I posted 5 stars for the 16" model, but can not say that for this particular case. I had it for very short time and it worked perfect , before the engine stopped. I love this brand name and expect that my case is and exception.
customer_reviews.author: Natalia Villarreal

customer_reviews.title: BEWARE!! Dead on arrival and not returnable
customer_reviews.text: This unit was non-operational and the motor seemed to be frozen. Would not turn over as well. While the description does not tell you that the item is not returnable, it is not. Very disappointed in Amazon with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Proud American

customer_reviews.title: Lots of power & Easy to Handle
customer_reviews.text: So much power for such a small saw. It cuts with ease and I like the safety feature that won't allow it to turn on unless the handle is moved into a certain position. A little difficult to get the sawdust out in the covered casing though. I like to clean it before I put it away. It is not something I use daily but it tackled some small trees easily.
customer_reviews.author: C. DeMar

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, plenty of power for small to medium jobs.
customer_reviews.text: Solid performer, I use it to trim firewood and small tree branches. This is a corded electric chainsaw, no batteries involved. Plenty of power for what I need. I got tired of trying to start gas powered saws so I went to this one, and I’m glad I did. Just plug in an extension cord and off you go.
customer_reviews.author: S. Peterson

customer_reviews.title: Best bang for the buck for sure!!
customer_reviews.text: I have never used a electric chain saw. they were always gas powered. I have to say this saw performs very well , better than i expected. and i really like the quick chain tightener. I don't think for a 15 amp.saw at this price you can find a better deal. it cut through a 10 inch elm tree with ease. so i would recommend this saw for anyone who wants a good saw for under 100 dollars.
customer_reviews.author: randy

customer_reviews.title: Push hard on hand guard to lock in place
customer_reviews.text: The instructions need to be more clear about the safety movable hand guard. We took it out of the box, put the oil in and tried to start it with no luck. The manual is not clear that you need to push real hard to lock the guard in place. We thought it was defective so asked for a replacement. I later googled about having trouble starting this model and someone else had the same problem. They were told to push hard on the hand guard so we tried again and it locked into place so was able to start it. Otherwise it works great.
customer_reviews.author: CHERYL FOSS

customer_reviews.title: You won't be disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I have now cut over 30 trees of varying sizes. I am very pleased with the saw. It's easy to change the chain and clean up the residue. I don't find the chain oil use to be excessive, I'm still on my first quart. I have about 10 more trees to go, then it will probably be rarely used. Use the Worx chains, in my experience they are sharper and cut better than the Oregon S63 chains.
customer_reviews.author: Kris Cooke

customer_reviews.title: Works like a champ.
customer_reviews.text: I've owned several other electric chainsaws in the past. This one does just fine and keeps up with my 20" gas Echo Timberwolf. We used this saw quite a bit during our clean up from Hurricane Michael. It cut through trees that were over 15" in diameter with ease. The key is to keep the chain sharpened as you use it. That's true for any chainsaw though. When you feel like you're having to exert excessive pressure to make it cut, it's time to stop, take a break and sharpen the chain. Takes all of 5 minutes. My wife is the primary user of this saw and she likes it's handling and light weight.
customer_reviews.author: Harry B. Grier III

customer_reviews.title: Great Saw
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use. Cut very well on a larger tree of about 24 inch diameter. It will cut a little slower than a high end gas model but the cost is so much less. The simplicity of just plugging this saw in and using it is so much better than wondering if my gas powered saw is going to start. I have had electric pole saws that also seem to last forever but I am just an occasional user of my chain saws. I may use them 4 or 5 times a year. These may not be suitable for a professional.
customer_reviews.author: DJ

customer_reviews.title: Great Saw
customer_reviews.text: VMInnovations got the saw to me very quickly and at a very reasonable price. This is a great tool. It is very well made and powerful enough for just about any job around the house. It is easy to use, runs smoothly and there is no fussing with the usual engine issues that come with gas powered chainsaws. The automatic chain oil and tensioning functions are superb. I'd buy this again, but I suspect I'll never have to do that. This saw is made to last.
customer_reviews.author: Satisfied in Seattle

customer_reviews.title: Better than i thought
customer_reviews.text: I was impressed with this saw. I have cut some trees 10 inches thick with plenty of power. if you just need a saw for occasional use this is the saw. I got tired of my old gas saw not starting to do some odd projects. yes it has a cord but you get used to it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is an absouletely great saw!
customer_reviews.text: This is an absouletely great saw! Heavy duty, powerful, starts everytime you pull the trigger, light weight, easy to tighten the chain, a automatic oiler that works and it did not cost a fortune. This saw and chain have impressed me because I have cut trees and branches larger than the 18 inch bar. I have cut the wood to fireplace length and have hauled away six F-150 paced loads of tree debris and the chain is still sharp enough to cut more.
customer_reviews.author: Roger L. White

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: right out of the box it is ready to go. works very well. so much better then a gas saw. quite and it does a great job for us home do it yourselfers. you will want to buy extra oil. the oil that comes with it is only a very little tiny bottle. so order an extra quart so you have it on hand. the little bottle will get you through for a short time.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Perfect if you only use it once or twice a  year
customer_reviews.text: We had a walnut tree that had to much new growth at the top that it fractured the backside about 10ft from the base and it would of have hit our house, So unfortunately had to come down. We hate cutting trees but this 19" saw came in handy. We had a professional cut the canopy off and I did the rest. Be sure to order extra oil and a chain with it.. I haven't had to change the chain yet but the oil they supply isn't very much.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Good chainsaw
customer_reviews.text: This a just a great chainsaw. Never had an electric before, always gas chainsaws. I was truly surprised to see how well it handled the trees and limbs in our yard. We have approximately thirty small to large trees in the yard that on occasion need cutting and trimming. I am pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: rainbow

customer_reviews.title: Works well, good value
customer_reviews.text: Cuts logs like butter. Inevitably, when it clogs with twigs and branches or the chain gets fouled (as all chainsaws do), the tensioning knob is a handy way of quickly clearing debris and resetting the chain. Powerful, handy, and a good value.
customer_reviews.author: Science Tech

customer_reviews.title: Decent for the cost.
customer_reviews.text: The product is decent and I like that I can plug and play. No gas to worry about and my yard is small enough to manage that. But the chainsaw lacks power. It takes twice the time to do my projects. Pros and cons I suppose. Decent for the cost.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Best chainsaw I've ever owned
customer_reviews.text: Was told by my local Lowes not to get it. Said it had no power and was not the equal of a Gas Chainsaw despite what Worx says! WRONG! WRONG WRONG! This has been the best little chainsaw I've ever had and I have had several gas models! Not only is it the equal of a small Stihl Gas chainsaw but it is more convenient. No priming, no pulling a starter rope till your arms ache, Just pull the trigger and go! Oh did I mention that it cost about half the price of a Stihl?
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Cuts Fast!
customer_reviews.text: Cuts fast! Made short work of a large pine tree. The large black knob tightens and loosens the chain, and, if you turn it far enough, unscrews to remove the chain cover and bar. It wasn't obvious to me how to remove that cover. It's easy once you know. Like all chain saws, the chain will loosen quickly in the first few minutes of break-in. Check chain tension frequently.
customer_reviews.author: J. M. Cox

customer_reviews.title: What a Great Purchase!
customer_reviews.text: This Chainsaw is AWESOME! I've always owned a gas chainsaw and admittedly it has always been a pain to mix oil and gas and properly drain prior to the winter snow. We had some heavy wet snow that brought down a number of large tree limbs on multiple trees and this saw is cutting right through them easily. I've always been skeptical of electric yard equipment, but this chainsaw is excellent!!
customer_reviews.author: Varney

customer_reviews.title: This thing cuts wood like a hot knife through butter
customer_reviews.text: This thing cuts wood like a hot knife through butter. I used it to cut a tree limb that fell in my yard that was around a foot thick. I wouldn't try to use it to cut huge trees but it's a nice chainsaw. No mixing gas and oil or gummed up gas in the carburetor. Also it shipped 1 day sooneer than it was supposed to. Thanks Amazon!
customer_reviews.author: Bo S.

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the money
customer_reviews.text: This saw surprised the heck out of me. All I had ever used were gas powered and wasn’t expecting much from a corded chain saw. So far it’s impressed me with the power it puts out. The cord is kind of a pain, but compared to mixing gas and oil plus yanking on a cord several times to start it, it’s worth the effort. Thrilled to death with it so far.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Goletto

customer_reviews.title: Hand tightens!
customer_reviews.text: What a delight to use this saw. Chain tensioner is brilliantly designed. If the chain kicks off while in use, as virtually all chains will do, you need NO TOOLS to get back to cutting. All hand-tightening! The feel, the heft, the features are all well designed. Electric under $100? Go Worx without a doubt.
customer_reviews.author: Milwaukeeroad

customer_reviews.title: The beast
customer_reviews.text: This chainsaw is a beast. It does a super, super job. I think the safety features could be improved but are pretty good. The chain tensioning mechanism is good but could be improved. Otherwise, I love this saw! Well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: BIOYA

customer_reviews.title: Easier to get going than a gas saw. No more cord pulling to start a cold engine.
customer_reviews.text: So easy to use. I don't have to worry about mixing fuel or bad fuel gumming up the engine after winter storage. Plug it in, it works. It's also a lot quieter than a gas saw. You are limited to working near a power source, but most of my yard work is within extension cord distance of my house. Going to get their weed trimmer next.
customer_reviews.author: Nozoki

customer_reviews.title: Parts not available
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product in the past and had trouble with the chain coming off but it otherwise seemed to work fine. Now the Chain works for a few seconds and then the motor runs but the chain does not move. I was told that the Drive Sprocket had worn down and a new one was needed. Contacted to company and was told that they did not have a replacement part? They are still selling it but don't make replacement parts? They said that the best that they could do was to offer me a discount. The cost of the discount was more than it now costs from AMAZON.
customer_reviews.author: John A. Seibel

customer_reviews.title: This thing works great! After the late March snow storm(where heavy wet ...
customer_reviews.text: This thing works great! After the late March snow storm(where heavy wet snow knocked down a huge pine tree) I decided to buy this chain saw to chop it up. Normally I'd buy those cheap $70 home improvement store gas chain saw, but saw the ratings of this electric chain saw on Amazon and decided to pony up the money to get it. I was not disappointed! It cut up the tree like butter!
customer_reviews.author: Weather Freak

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good. Used it twice and it seems to work well.
customer_reviews.text: This was bought to replace my 18" Husqvarna, and I'm pleasantly surprised. I've used it twice to process fallen ash trees, and it works well. The bad reviews I read for the other comparable product may have been in regards to the fact that it had to be assembled. This arrived ready to go (just add bar oil), and I've had no problems...so far, so good.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: best chain saw purchase I've ever made!
customer_reviews.text: Ive used gas chain saws and electric, this is by far the best one i've ever used. Way better value than any gas chain saw I've ever used!! It's not quite as strong or fast on 18" or wider tree's .... But it is capable! I was able to cut down a 20-24 inch wide tree in bout 30-60 minutes~
customer_reviews.author: Coffee Kat

customer_reviews.title: ... cuts well enough (I cut a 13" diameter tree like butter) and gets the job done around smaller suburban ...
customer_reviews.text: Being limited by an extension cord is rough but it cuts well enough (I cut a 13" diameter tree like butter) and gets the job done around smaller suburban yards. I don't use it a lot either, so it's nice to pull it out of the shed and start it right up rather than messing with gas that's gone bad or having to mix fuel, etc..
customer_reviews.author: Locus

customer_reviews.title: Powerful and Easy
customer_reviews.text: After loosing a Cyprus tree to heavy wind last fall, I thought I would man up and buy a chainsaw so I could handle the issue myself. After reading up on good chainsaws for homeowners, I settled on this Worx electric chainsaw and it couldn't be happier. It's plenty powerful and made quick work of the job. With the automatic chain tensioner, it's simple to use. Buy some bar and chain oil and an appropriately gauged extension cord, and you'll be good to go. I think I'll leave tree-felling to the pros, but for cleanup jobs around the yard, this is a great buy.
customer_reviews.author: Caraptor

product_meta.title: WORX WG304.1 Chain Saw 18-Inch 4 15.0 Amp
product_meta.description:
Product Packaging:Standard PackagingThe 18-Inch 4.0 HP 15.0 Amp chainsaw is a cut above the rest. The WORX exclusive, patented tool-free chain replacement and auto-tensioning system eliminates the headaches faced with most other chain saws. You don't need to be a lumberjack to operate a chainsaw. The auto-tension system includes a single, oversized knob that secures the bar and chain and maintains proper tension during operation-automatically. The WORX auto-tensioning system also works to extend bar and chain life by eliminating any chance of over-tightening. What's more, all-metal dogs at the base of the long, 18-inch bar help add stability during cutting, while an easy-to-lubricate sprocket on the bar nose helps preserve the life of the tool. Powerful enough for your toughest jobs, the WORX electric chain saws produce anywhere from 4.0 peak horsepower. The WORX 18-Inch chainsaw also offers gas-free, hassle-free operation. Different from gas-powered chain saws, our electric chain saw doesn't require you to mix oil and gas or deal with difficult startups. And unlike the competition, the WORX features an automatic oiler that provides constant lubrication to both the bar and chain. Each WORX chain saw is equipped with a 6.75-ounce oil reservoir with an oil level indicator. Designed for Safety and Comfort. The WORX chain saws include a built-in safety chain brake that stops the chain in seconds when improper contact is made, protecting you in the event of kickback. Additionally, a rubber over-molded rear handle and ergonomic full-wrap front handle provide optimum operator control and comfort. POINTS TO REMEMBER: 1) Remove oil cap and immediately restore it after operation. This relieves any pressure during the oiling process. 2) Allow the saw to cool down before storing. 3) Remove oil from saw before storage. 4) Wipe down the saw sprocket area 5) Use only enough oil for the task at hand

AMAZON.COM


The WORX WG304.1 18-inch Chain Saw is a robust and lightweight power tool that is perfect for quick, easy jobs around your yard or farm, such as cutting firewood, clearing brush, trimming trees, and more. In addition, the WG304.1 produces no harmful emissions and has minimal operating costs when compared to gas-powered chain saws. 

Electric motor for emission-free operation (view larger). A CUT ABOVE THE REST
The WG304.1's exclusive, patented tool-free chain replacement and auto-tensioning system eliminate the headaches faced with most other chain saws. You'll never again worry about whether the chain blade is tight and secure. The auto-tension system includes a single, oversized knob that secures the bar and chain and maintains proper tension during operation--automatically. The WORX auto-tensioning system also works to extend bar and chain life by eliminating any chance of over-tightening. 

What's more, all-metal dogs at the base of the long, 18-inch bar help add stability during cutting, while an easy-to-lubricate sprocket on the bar nose helps preserve the life of the tool. 

Comes fully assembled and ready to go (view larger). GAS-FREE, HASSLE-FREE OPERATION
The WORX WG304.1 is powered by electricity, so it produces no noxious emissions. Different from gas-powered chain saws, the WG304.1 doesn't require you to mix oil and gas or deal with difficult startups. And unlike the competition, the WG304.1 features an automatic oiler that provides constant lubrication to both the bar and chain. Just as all WORX models, the WG304.1 is equipped with a 6.75-ounce oil reservoir with an oil level indicator. 

DESIGNED FOR SAFETY AND COMFORT
The WORX WG304.1 includes a built-in safety brake that stops the chain in seconds when improper contact is made, protecting you in the event of kickback. Additionally, a rubber over-molded rear handle and ergonomic full-wrap front handle provide optimum operator control and comfort. 

WHAT'S IN THE BOX
WORX WG304.1 Chain Saw; one scabbard; one quart of chain oil; operating instructions

Tool-free chain tensioning system via oversized knob (view larger). Automatic oiler provides constant lubrication to both bar and chain (view larger).
feature_bullets: 15.0 Amp motor output delivers a more powerful cutting performance to the extended, 18 inch bar
Patented auto tension chain system prevents over tightening; stays at the right tension for hundreds of uses
Low kick back bar and built in chain brake for added safety; Chain Links : 63
Automatic oil lubrication and built in oil reservoir with window level indicator; Oil tank capacity : 200 milliliter
Comes fully assembled right out of the box, and includes 3 year manufacturer’s warranty
Note: Please refer user manual below for better use which is highly recommended

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars1,503 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
